conversation.thought: I am Student_C. School_D is my absolute highest preference (Rank 1). I must prioritize securing this match. School_D ranks me 3rd overall. While Student_D (Rank 1 for School_D) and Student_E (Rank 2 for School_D) are ahead of me, their own preferences for School_D are low (Rank 5 and Rank 4, respectively). Given that we are in Round 7 and I have been gathering information elsewhere (School_E), now is the critical time to apply to my top choice before it matches with another student. I will submit a formal application.

conversation.message: Dear Student_C, thank you for your compelling application and for recognizing School_D as your top choice. We are highly impressed by your commitment and believe you possess the qualities necessary to thrive in our academic environment. We are pleased to offer you immediate admission to School_D.
conversation.thought: Student_C is ranked 3rd on School_D's priority list (['Student_D', 'Student_E', 'Student_C', 'Student_B', 'Student_A']). Students D (Rank 1) and E (Rank 2) are not available (matched elsewhere, as they are not in the unmatched list). Student_C is therefore the highest-priority student currently available in the market. Furthermore, School_D is Student_C's top choice, ensuring a stable match. Given the remaining quota of 1, securing this high-priority match now is optimal to prevent being left with only Student_A (Rank 5) or going unmatched entirely.
